html:
** Shares of Apple AAPL.O, Microsoft MSFT.O, Google owner Alphabet GOOGL.O, and Amazon.com AMZN.O, the four biggest U.S. companies by market cap, dip 2.1%-3.6%

** Other tech giants also fall as banks and investors expect a high interest rate environment in 2022, which pushed yields to fresh two-year highs .N (Full Story)

** Tech stocks generally weaken with rising bond yields and interest rates as investors tend to discount future tech earnings in comparison to higher debt returns US/

** Meanwhile, MSFT's augmented reality team lost 100 people over the past year to other companies, mainly to FB, according to a WSJ report (Full Story)

** Tesla TSLA.O falls 2.1% and loses its trillion-dollar valuation amid a wider EV selloff; CEO Elon Musk tweeted on Friday that TSLA will raise the U.S. price of its cars' advanced driver assistant software (Full Story) (Full Story)

** Chipmaker Nvidia NVDA.O loses 4.8%

** Meta Platforms FB.O and Twitter TWTR.N drop 2.9%-4.3%

** Spotify SPOT.N, Zoom Video Communications ZM.O and Netflix NFLX.O decline 1.9%-4%

** Meanwhile, bank stocks benefit from expectations of a tightening monetary policy (Full Story)


(Reporting by Ruhi Soni in Bengaluru)

(( Ruhi.Soni@thomsonreuters.com ; Twitter: https://twitter.com/ruhithere ;;))
